intro: Telinaria hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish telinaria, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous flowers throughout the summer months. Telinaria hispanica is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
